PenalCodes.Description: May result in suspended or revoked license, a fine and possible jail time

Data.Explanation: Careless and unlawful operation of a vehicle.
Operating a motor vehicle without proper paperwork.

Data.Violation: Driving without headlights or tail lights
Data.Explanation: Operation of a vehicle without use of headlights or tail lights in an appropriate situation.
Unnecessary or too much sound.

Data.Violation: Failure to obey a traffic control device
Data.Explanation: Violation of intersection lights, stop and give way signs.
Being in multiple lanes at once or swerving in between lanes.

Data.Violation: Failure to yield to a pedestrian
Data.Explanation: Failing to yield to a pedestrian in a marked crosswalk.

Data.Violation: Failure to yield to an emergency vehicle
Data.Explanation: Failing to yield to an Emergency vehicle with red and or blue lights.
U-Turn conducted in either a disallowed zone or an unsafe turn.
Parking illegally in a zone disallowing parking.
Interrupting the flow of traffic in anyway for an extended period of time.
Self explanatory
Failing to obey posted speed signs.
Failing to obey posted speed signs.
Failing to obey posted speed signs.
Red and blue underglow, pure black window tint or police horn.
Operation of a motorized vehicle that is not fit to be operated on a public roads. No license plates, expired tabs, cracked windshield.
A person who has in their possession tools necessary to commit burglary such as a crowbar with a screwdriver, shimmy, or other appropriate items.

Data.Violation: Improper use of a motor vehicle
Data.Explanation: Improper use of a motor vehicle like not wearing a helmet on a motorcycle, or seatbelt in car.

PenalCodes.Description: A small violation, prohibited by a statute. But it's not a crime. Usually results in a fine

Data.Explanation: Unruly behaviour constituting a minor offense.
When a person's words or conduct jeopardizes another's rights to peace and tranquility.
To delay or linger in the vicinity of a posted property with no purpose or lawful reason.
A person who is found in any public place under the influence of alcohol.
Crossing a public road at an otherwise unmarked crossing.

PenalCodes.Description: Results in a fine, jail sentence or both depending on the crime

Data.Explanation: A person who intentionally put another in the reasonable belief of physical harm or offensive contact.
A person who continuously intentionally put another in the reasonable belief of severe physical harm or offensive contact.
The act of aiding somebody or a group in the process of a crime.
A person who uses a unlawful force or violence to cause physical harm.
A person who uses great or continued force or violence to cause physical harm.
The action of forcing your way into a property you do not have permission to be in.
The act of holding or pointing a unconcealed weapon on or attached to your body.
Attempting to give items of value and worth to receive a favorable outcome.
A person who willfully disobeys, disrespects, or otherwise infringes the verbal or written authority of the court.
The act of inflicting damage to property public or private.

Data.Violation: Drug possession Class: A, B, C
Data.JailTime: A) 1 min 30 sec, B) 1 min, C) 50 sec
Data.Explanation: Possession of one or less pound.
Operating a motorized vehicle while under the influence of alcohol or drugs.

Data.Violation: Failure to follow a lawful command
Data.Explanation: Willingly disobeying a lawful command given by a government official.

Data.Violation: Failure to identify to a LEO
Data.Explanation: A person who is detained or under arrest by a LEO and fails to provide their name or ID.
A person who fails to pay a fine or court ordered fee.

Data.Violation: Failure to have a valid permit
Data.Explanation: Not having a valid permit.
A person who knowingly files a false complaint, statement or document.
A person who intentionally exposes their naked body or genitalia.
Unsanctioned and illegal form of auto racing that occurs on a public road.
Helping and or planning a street racing event.
An action that shows a clear motivated attempt to stop/halt a law enforcement officer from doing their job.

Data.Violation: Providing false information to a LEO
Data.Explanation: Providing a government official with false information.
The act of placing the public in any kind of way.
A person that follows, threatens or harasses another individual.
A person who commits verbal abuse for the purpose of sexual arousal.
Entering private property that you do not have permission to reside in.
A person who takes or steals another’s property.
Discharge of a firearm without due cause or justifiable motive.
A person that defaces, damages, or destroys property which belongs to another.
A person who intentionally withholds information from a LEO.

Data.Violation: Failure to stop for a police vehicle
Data.Explanation: Self explanatory
A person who intentionally wastes a LEO’s time.

PenalCodes.Description: A crime, typically one involving violence, regarded as more serious than a misdemeanor, and punishable by imprisonment

Data.Explanation: A person who takes property from the possession of another with a weapon.
A person who helps commit or plan to take property from the possession of another with a weapon.
A person who intentionally malicious sets fire to any structure, forest land, or property.
A person who attempts to cause or threaten immediate harm to another using a weapon to communicate that threat.

Data.Violation: Accessory to assault with a deadly weapon
Data.Explanation: A person who helps commit or plan to attempt to cause or threaten immediate harm to another using a weapon to cummunicate that threat.
A person who intentionally put another in the reasonable belief or physical harm or offensive contact to a LEO.
A person who deliberately attempt to kill or cause life threatening.
A person who deliberately helps or plans to attempt to kill or cause life threatening harm.
A person who deliberately attempt to kill or cause life threatening harm.

Data.Violation: Accessory to attempted murder of a LEO
Data.Explanation: A person who deliberately helps or cause life threatening harm of a LEO.
A government employee who acts outside the interests of the public good or public justice.

Data.Violation: Dissuading a witness or a victim
Data.Explanation: A person who knowingly and maliciously prevents or encourages a witness or victim from giving a testimony.
Selling or giving away illegal firearms.
A person who intimidates or influences to provide or hand over properties or services.
A person who has been detained and arrested, booked, charged, or convicted of any crime who escapes from custody.
A person that helps or plans someone who has been detained and arrested, booked, charged or convicted of any crime who escapes from custody.

Data.JailTime: Class:A 3 minutes Class:B 2 minutes Class:C 1 minute
Data.Explanation: Possession of a illegal substance one pound or more.
A person who runs away from police in a vehicle or on foot to elude arrest or questioning.
Leaving the scene of an accident.
A person who has stolen a motor vehicle.
A person who knowingly provides false information while under oath in a court of law.
A person who exchanges sexual acts for payment or other goods.
A person who solicits or advertises and supervises anyone involved in prostitution.

Data.Violation: Possession of a illegal firearm Class A
Data.Explanation: A person who was in possession of a illegal pistol or handgun.

Data.Violation: Possession of a illegal firearm Class B
Data.Explanation: A person who was in possession of a illegal shotgun.

Data.Violation: Possession of a illegal firearm Class C
Data.Explanation: A person who was in possession of a illegal fully automatic firearm.

Data.Violation: Improper use of a motor vehicle
Data.Explanation: A person who excessively speeds and is driving recklessly.
A person who unintentionally kills another.
A person who pretends or implies the role of a police officer.
A person who detains or arrests another without their consent and unlawfully.
A person who unlawfully kills another.
A person who helps or plans to unlawfully kills another.
A person who unlawfully kills a LEO.

Data.Violation: Accessory to murder of a LEO
Data.Explanation: A person who helps or plans the unlawfully kills of a LEO.
Planning to or discussing to commit murder.
Paying to have an individual(s) killed.
A person who commits unwanted touching or sexual contact.
A person who avoids apprehension from an officer by any means.
A person who forces another to engage in sexual activities.
A person who, without proper authorization enters any government owned or managed facility that is secured with the intent of keeping people out.
A person who uses threats or actions against the public to cause fear at a grand scale.
A person who attempts to effect justice according to their own understanding of right and wrong.
A person who is in possession of a blade over three inches.

Data.JailTime: 1st offense= 5min jail. 2nd offense= 10min jail 3rd offense= 15min jail. If anybody continues to Cop/Civ bait after 3 offenses you will be contacted by an Admin.
